intro: Sorindeia obtusifoliolata, commonly known as the broad-leafed sorindeia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves with rounded lobes and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
